name: California/Mexican Cauliflower Rice with Avocado and Kale

image.caption: California/Mexican Cauliflower Rice with Avocado and Kale

description: This seems like a lot of steps, but it's very easy and quick to put together. It can be prepped ahead of time; just add the avocado and egg at the end. To make it even easier, the cauliflower rice can be made ahead and refrigerated or frozen.
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 small bunch fresh cilantro, finely chopped
2 green onions, chopped, or more to taste
1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 (7 ounce) can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
4 leaves Tuscan kale, stemmed and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Place cauliflower florets in a food processor; pulse into rice-sized pieces.
Combine cauliflower "rice", black beans, cilantro, green onions, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, lime juice, salt, and pepper in a microwave-safe bowl; toss until mixed. Top with Cheddar cheese.
Puree chipotle peppers in adobo in a small bowl with an immersion blender.

Heat remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add zucchini in an even layer; place kale on top. Cook, covered, until zucchini is lightly browned and kale starts to wilt, about 5 minutes. Stir in 1 to 3 tablespoons pureed chipotle peppers. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, allowing kale to steam, 3 to 5 minutes.
Fill a saucepan with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, add eggs, and simmer, about 7 minutes. Remove eggs with a slotted spoon and run under cool water for 30 to 60 seconds. Peel carefully.
Spoon zucchini mixture over Cheddar cheese in the bowl. Microwave until hot, 2 to 3 minutes. Top with peeled eggs and sliced avocado. Season with salt and pepper.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: California/Mexican Cauliflower Rice with Avocado and Kale

review.reviewBody: It turned out really well but I made quite a few changes. I fried the cauliflower a bit first before adding anything else. I used shredded cheddar. I cubed the zucchini. I toned down the adobo a lot only using a tbsp. plus 1/4 cup Greek yogurt. I used a sunny side up egg. I didn't microwave anything. DH loved it. will make again

This was surprisingly good. A a nice alternative to the beans and rice I usually serve with Mexican food. Instead of a can of chiles, I diced up a jalapeño and tossed it in with the zucchini. Also sprinkled some chipotle chili powder and Adobe seasoning in the pan. Omitted the eggs. Used regular kale bc that’s what I had. I will make this again.
